(Simplified: 牍)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 賣 indicates the sound; 片 (page) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 片 [ piàn ] slice, splinter; page, strip
    • 賣 [ mài ] to sell; to betray; to show off
①古代寫字用的木片：文牘(公文)。尺牘(書信)。案牘。
②古代樂器名。
(Simplified: 牍)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 賣 indicates the sound; 片 (page) conveys the meaning.
Hanzi: 牍

Traditional in your browser 繁体字的浏览器显示:牘

Traditional in Unicode standard 繁体字的Unicode标准:U+7258

Older traditional characters 旧繁体字/异体字: 𤘄

Simplified in your browser 简体字的浏览器显示:牍

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+724D

Main pronunciation 主要发音: dú

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning writing tablet.

English senses 英语理解: writing tablet; documents, books

Usage example 用法举例: 案牘 àn dú (official correspondence)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 3138

Shuowen 说文解字: 書版也從片賣聲

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 牘 from table-right 片 piàn and phonetic sell-variant (卖)賣𧶠𧸇 yù and(not- 卖賣𧷵 mài) simp 牍.

牘字的基本解释

牘
dú
见“牍”。

牘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dú］
［《廣韻》徒谷切，入屋，定。］
“牍1”的繁体字。
(1)古代写字用的木板。
(2)借指纸张、稿纸。
(3)书信；公文。
(4)指奏章。
(5)书籍。
(6)古乐器名。

牘字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【片字部】　牘； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页694第32
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】徒谷切【正韻】杜谷切，?音讀。【說文】書版也。【莊子·列禦寇】小夫之知，不離苞苴竿牘。【戰國策】取筆牘受之。【註】牘，書版也。【史記·倉公傳贊】緹縈通尺牘。【前漢·昌邑王傳】持牘趨謁。【註】師古曰：牘，木簡也。　又樂器。【周禮·春官·笙師】舂牘應雅，以敎祴樂。【註】牘應雅敎其舂者，謂以築地。【疏】舂牘以竹，大五六寸，長七尺，短者一二尺，其端有兩孔，髤畫，以兩手築地。牘應雅敎其舂者，謂賔醉而出，奏祴夏。以此三器築地，謂之行節。【釋名】舂，撞也。牘，筑也。以舂築地爲節也。　【韻會】毛氏曰：說文从片賣聲。當作賣。从罒非。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dú］
["Guangyun" Tuguqie, enter the house, set. ]
Traditional characters for "牍1".
(1) Wooden boards used in ancient writing.
(2) Borrowing refers to paper and manuscript paper.
(3) Letters; official documents.
(4) Refers to the memorial.
(5) Books.
(6) The name of the ancient musical instrument.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Centralized Collection] [Film Word Department] 　牍; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 694 No. 32
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Tu Gu Qi [Zheng Yun] Du Gu Qi, pronunciation. [Said Wen] The book version is also. [Zhuangzi·Lee Yukou] The little husband’s knowledge is inseparable from the bamboo shoots. [Warring States Policy] Take the pen and accept it. [Note] Tablets, book editions also. [Historical Records·Cang Gong Chuan Zan] Tiying through ruler slips. [Previous Han·Changyi Wang Chuan] Holding a slip and tending to greet. [Note] Shi Gu said: Tablets, wooden slips.　A musical instrument. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Sheng Shi】The pounding 牍ying ya, in order to bring joy. [Note] The person who drew the puppets by the yin ying ya is called Tsukiji. 【Sparse】The pounding slab is made of bamboo, five or six inches in size, seven feet long, and one or two feet short, with two holes at the end and a scorpion painting. The ground is built with both hands. The tablet should be drunk by the yam, saying that the bladder came out drunk and played the summer. Tsukiji with these three tools is called the festival. 【Release name】Chong, hit too. Dot, build also. Take Tsukiji as a festival.　【Yunhui】Mao said: Saying Wencong is selling well. Treat it as a sale. Cong Fei.
